birthBeforeParentsBirth.title: Person Born Before their Parent(s)
birthBeforeParentsBirth.description:
Thing One, born January 1, 1820, was born before one or more of their parents.

  • Thelma Louise - January 1, 1900
  • Bob Freemer - January 1, 1895

Go to FamilySearch and update the person or their parent's birth date(s).

Help

  • Correcting information in the Family Tree
  • Explaining approximate birth dates

place.original: Provo, Utah, United States of America

childBeforeMarriage.title: Child Born Before Marriage
childBeforeMarriage.description:
It is abnormal for a child to be born before a couple is married. Check the marriages with the following people to verify that the marriage date and children's birth dates and fix any incorrect information in the Family Tree.

  • Elmer Fudd was born 1 year and 4 months before John Adams married Mary Adams.
  • Mary Sue was born 1 year and 4 months before John Adams married Sarah Jane.

Help

  • Correcting information in the Family Tree

childrenTooClose.title: Children Too Close
childrenTooClose.description:
Sarah Sue has children born less than 9 months apart. This can only happen with the birth of twins or a premature birth. Examine the birth dates of these children closely to verify that they are correct. Find sources to support the birth dates if you can.

  • Adam Smith was born 8 months after Joe Adams
  • Mary Jane was born 2 months after Adam Smith
  • Laura Doe was born 4 months after Mary Jane

deathBeforeBirth.title: Person Died Before They Were Born
deathBeforeBirth.description:
A person cannot die before they were born. Visit Mary Sue in the Family Tree and fix the issue by doing one of the following:

  • Change the birth date to be before the death date
  • Change the death date to be after the birth date

Help

  • Correcting information in the Family Tree
  • Explaining approximate birth dates

duplicateNames.title: Identical Names
duplicateNames.description:
This person has names which differ only by capitalization or punctuation. It is not necessary to document all of the different ways a name could be capitalized or punctuated. View Mary Sue in the Family Tree and delete some of the unnecessary names.

  • Preferred Name
  • preferred.NAME
  • Alternate Name
  • alternate-name

Help

  • Adding more information about a person who is already in Family Tree
  • Adding a custom event or fact to a person
  • Correcting information about a person

manyAlternateNames.title: Many Alternate Names
manyAlternateNames.description:
When a person has many alternate names they are often duplicates, slight misspellings, or differ only in punctuation. Consider deleting some of the alternate names that aren't necessary in the Family Tree.

  • Alternate Name 1
  • Alternate Name 2
  • Alternate Name 3
  • Alternate Name 4
  • Alternate Name 5

Help

  • Adding more information about a person who is already in Family Tree
  • Adding a custom event or fact to a person
  • Correcting information about a person

marriageAfterDeath.title: Marriage After Death
marriageAfterDeath.description:
Elmer Gate died 1 June 1950 but has marriage events which occurred after that date. This is impossible. Either the death date is wrong or the marriage dates are wrong. View the couple relationships in FamilySearch to fix the problem.

  • Molly Sue - A marriage event occured 3 months after Elmer Gate's death.
  • Sarah Jane - A marriage event occured 1 year and 9 months after Elmer Gate's death.

marriageWithNoChildren.title: Marriage with no Children
marriageWithNoChildren.description:
Mary Jane has multiple marriages with no children. Though this is possible it still represents an opportunity for research until you are confident that the couples had no children.

  • Joe Adams
  • Henry Hancock

missingBirth.title: Find a Birth
missingBirth.description:
Try these steps to find the birth information for Bob Freemer:

  1. Review the record hints in FamilySearch.
  2. Do broad searches on popular genealogy websites using the links below or using the RootsSearch Chrome Extension.
  3. Ask for help at the Genealogy and Family History Stack Exchange website.
  4. Visit a local Family History Center.
  5. Hire a researcher from the Genlighten community.

missingGivenName.title: Missing a Given Name
missingGivenName.description:
This person is missing a given name. It's possible that the name is known but not filled in. Check to see if the given name appears in the list of alternate names or in any of the attached records. It is possible that the person never had a given name, such as a child that died at birth.

Help

  • Adding more information about a person who is already in Family Tree
  • Adding a custom event or fact to a person
  • Correcting information about a person

missingMarriageDate.title: Find a Marriage Date
missingMarriageDate.description:
The marriage between Thelma Louise and Bob Freemer has no marriage date. Try these steps to find the marriage date:

  1. Review the record hints in FamilySearch for both Thelma Louise and Bob Freemer.
  2. Do broad searches on popular genealogy websites using the links below or using the RootsSearch Chrome Extension.
  3. Ask for help at the Genealogy and Family History Stack Exchange website.
  4. Visit a local Family History Center.
  5. Hire a researcher from the Genlighten community.

missingName.title: Missing a Name
missingName.description:
This person's name is not known. There are few reasons for a person to exist in the tree without a name. In fact, FamilySearch no longer allows people to be created without a name. If there is no other information nor relationships for this person then you can safely delete the person.

Help

  • Adding more information about a person who is already in Family Tree
  • Adding a custom event or fact to a person
  • Correcting information about a person
  • Deleting a person from Family Tree

missingSurname.title: Missing a Surname
missingSurname.description:
This person is missing a surname. It's possible that the surname is known but not filled in. Check to see if the surname appears in the list of alternate names or in any of the attached records. In most areas of the world, the surname can be inferred if the names of the parents are known.

Help

  • Adding more information about a person who is already in Family Tree
  • Adding a custom event or fact to a person
  • Correcting information about a person

multipleMarriageFacts.title: Multiple Marriage Facts
multipleMarriageFacts.description:
The marriage between Thelma Lousie and Elmer Fudd has multiple marriage events. This is only possible in the unlikely situation where the couple remarried after divorcing. Try to merge similar information and reduce the events down to just one. View their relationship in the Family Tree to correct this problem.

Help

  • Removing Marriage Facts in the Family Tree

multipleParents.title: Multiple Parent Relationships
multipleParents.description:
Sue Adams is listed as having multiple biological parents, which is highly improbable. Fix this problem by visiting Sue Adams in the Family Tree and examining the parent relationships.

Help

  • Correcting information in the Family Tree

orInName.title: Incorrect Alternate Name Format
orInName.description:
These alternate names have an "or" in it which is often incorrectly used to document alternate given names or alternate surnames. It is better to add the alternate form as a separate alternate name instead. In the Family Tree, add the alternate form as another alternate name and remove it from the original alternate name.

  • Joey or Joseph

Help

  • Adding more information about a person who is already in Family Tree
  • Adding a custom event or fact to a person
  • Correcting information about a person

possibleDuplicates.title: Possible Duplicate Persons
possibleDuplicates.description:
FamilySearch has identified 2 people as potential duplicates Bob Freemer. Review the list of duplicates in FamilySearch. Merge duplicate persons and mark incorrect matches as "Not a Match".

Help

  • Merging duplicate records in Family Tree

recordHints.title: Record Hints
recordHints.description:
FamilySearch has found matching records for Foo Bar in the following collections:

  • SSDI
  • Michigan Marriages
  • Another Great Collection

Review these matches and attach the sources to your tree.

Help

  • Record Hints

standardizeBirthDate.title: Standardize a Birth Date
standardizeBirthDate.description:
Elmer Fudd's birth date of January 1, 1900 has not been standardized.

Why?

Standardization ensures that everyone knows when this event took place. Because there are many date formats used accross the world, it may not always be obvious what the date actually is. Take 3/11/2000 for example. Is this March 11, 2000 or November 3, 2000? By standardizing the date we can avoid this confusion. Read a guide from FamilySearch about standardizing dates and places.

place.original: Provo, Utah, United States of America

standardizeBirthPlace.title: Standardize a Birth Place
standardizeBirthPlace.description:
Elmer Fudd's birth place of Provo, Utah, United States of America has not been standardized.

Why?

Standardization ensures that everyone knows where this event took place. Because there are many different ways to spell or qualify a place, it may not always be obvious where that place actually is. Take London for example. Is this the London in England, Kentucky, or Ontario? By standardizing the place we can avoid this confusion. Read a guide from FamilySearch about standardizing dates and places.

place.original: Provo, Utah, United States of America

Why?

Standardization ensures that everyone knows when this event took place. Because there are many date formats used accross the world, it may not always be obvious what the date actually is. Take 3/11/2000 for example. Is this March 11, 2000 or November 3, 2000? By standardizing the date we can avoid this confusion. Read a guide from FamilySearch about standardizing dates and places.

Why?

Standardization ensures that everyone knows where this event took place. Because there are many different ways to spell or qualify a place, it may not always be obvious where that place actually is. Take London for example. Is this the London in England, Kentucky, or Ontario? By standardizing the place we can avoid this confusion. Read a guide from FamilySearch about standardizing dates and places.

unusualCharactersInName.title: Unusual Characters in a Name
unusualCharactersInName.description:
This person has the following unusual characters in their name: ?. These characters are not normally found in names. Update the person's name in the Family Tree to remove the unusual characters.

Help

  • Adding more information about a person who is already in Family Tree
